legal_issues: Priority of payment of costs and disbursements
outcome_details: The court ruled against John Belton, declaring that the policy funds should be shared pro rata between the defendant Spencer and Martin & Hillyer. Since MHA waived their disbursements claim, the entire policy amount will offset Spencer's costs.
decision_factors: Application of general principles of insurance policy interpretation
cited_cases: Progressive Homes Ltd. v. Lombard General Insurance Co. of Canada, 2010 SCC 33
Ledcor Construction Ltd. v. Northbridge Indemnity Insurance Co., 2016 SCC 37
Peter B. Cozzi Professional Corporation v Szot, 2019 ONSC 1274
summary: The court addressed the issue of the distribution of Legal Expense Insurance funds after Belton's claim was dismissed and costs were awarded against him. MHA obtained the insurance, and a dispute arose concerning the entitlement and distribution of $100,000 policy funds. The ruling clarified the interpretation of the insurance policy, ordering a pro rata sharing of the funds. Belton's new application was dismissed, and the policy funds were allocated to offset the defendant's costs due to MHA's waiver of claims.
